subject: Re: [junit] Re: Same tests with varying initialization?
msgSnippet: ... nataliabello Hi, I am new using Junit and in this mailing list. nataliabello I have a question about setUp(); here it is: If i nataliabello overrride
messageBody:
>>>>> "nataliabello" == nataliabello <nataliabello@...> writes:

nataliabello> Hi, I am new using Junit and in this mailing list.
nataliabello> I have a question about setUp(); here it is: If i
nataliabello> overrride the setUp() and tearDown() methods in my
nataliabello> TestCase class, all the test methods, will execute
nataliabello> them? Are there any way to diferentiate between the
nataliabello> tests that should execute the setup and terdown and
nataliabello> the ones that shouldnt execute them? Thanks in
nataliabello> advance

Tests that share the same setUp and tearDown logic should be in the
same TestCase. Those that do not should be in other TestCase-derived
classes.

Whether or not tests share setUp methods is one smell that drives you
towards creating more than one TestCase class.

bab
